column.name: Mode_
column.summary: Enum:CommItemMode Phone, email, etc.

column.name: EFormDefNum
column.summary: FK to EFormDef.EFormDefNum. Can be zero if this row is for a sheet. Only for custom eForms.

column.name: EFormDefNum
column.summary: FKey to eformdef.EFormDefNum. This is only used alongside the eClipboardSheetDef table. When a patient checks in with eClipboard, we get all of the rows from the eClipboardSheetDef table. We start filtering them out by sheets and eForms. In this example, we are going to stick with eForms because this is the EFormDefNum. Next we get all past eForms that the patient has filled out. We then use the list of already completed eForms to filter out more eClipboardSheetDef objects and create new eForms when they need to be filled out again. For example, a HIPAA form might be set to only be filled out once, and this is how we know they already did so.

column.name: Status
column.summary: Enum:EnumEFormStatus 0-None, 1-ReadyForPatientFill, 2-Filled, 3-Imported. In the None status, the office might be filling in the tooth number on a consent form. In the ReadyForPatientFill status, it will show in eClipboard. Sheets uses ShowInTerminal for this purpose. Once the patient has filled it, the status is changed to Filled. Sheets uses IsWebForm for this purpose. A Filled eForm will then be imported automatically and the status changed to Imported. If the import process could not match to a known patient, then this status will be UnmatchedToPatient and the PatNum will remain 0 until user matches it.

Enumeration.name: EnumEFormStatus
Enumeration.EnumValue: 1 - Forms with this status will show in eClipboard.
4 - Import was attempted, but could not match a known patient in the database.

column.name: RevID
column.summary: Revision ID. Used to determine in conjunction with PrefillStatus for eClipboardSheetDef to determine whether to show a patient a new form or have them update their last filled out form. Must match up with EFormDef RevID to show a previously filled out form.

column.name: ShowLabelsBold
column.summary: If true, then this form will show labels at 95% and slightly bold. This looks good, but some users might not want it for certain forms, so it's an option. This applies to text, date, radiobuttons, and sigBox. It does not apply to types label, checkbox, or medicationList.

column.name: SpaceBelowEachField
column.summary: The amount of space below each field. Overrides the global default and can be overridden by field.SpaceBelow. -1 indicates to use default. That way, 0 means 0 space.

column.name: SpaceToRightEachField
column.summary: The amount of space to the right of each field. Overrides the global default and can be overridden by field.SpaceToRight. -1 indicates to use default. That way, 0 means 0 space.

column.name: RevID
column.summary: Revision ID. Gets updated any time an eForm field is added or deleted from an eFormDef (this includes any time a translation is changed). Used to determine in conjunction with PrefillStatus for eClipboardSheetDef to determine whether to show a patient a new form or have them update their last filled out form. Must match up with EForm RevID to show a previously filled out form.

column.name: ShowLabelsBold
column.summary: If true, then this form will show labels at 95% and slightly bold. This looks good, but some users might not want it for certain forms, so it's an option. This applies to text, date, radiobuttons, and sigBox. It does not apply to types label, checkbox, or medicationList.

column.name: SpaceBelowEachField
column.summary: The amount of space below each field. Overrides the global default and can be overridden by field.SpaceBelow. -1 indicates to use default. That way, 0 means 0 space.

column.name: SpaceToRightEachField
column.summary: The amount of space to the right of each field. Overrides the global default and can be overridden by field.SpaceToRight. -1 indicates to use default. That way, 0 means 0 space.

column.name: WidthLabel
column.summary: If the label is to the left of the field, this is the width of that label. Only used for RadioButtons right now because that's the only type that allows labels to the left. In RadioButtons, this is helpful to allow a stack of radioButtons to line up. Default is 0 to indicate automatic.

column.name: SpaceToRight
column.summary: The amount of space to the right of each field. Overrides the form and global defaults. -1 indicates to use default. That way, 0 means 0 space. Not used for SigBox or MedicationList which use form level instead.

column.name: WidthLabel
column.summary: If the label is to the left of the field, this is the width of that label. Only used for RadioButtons right now because that's the only type that allows labels to the left. In RadioButtons, this is helpful to allow a stack of radioButtons to line up. Default is 0 to indicate automatic.

column.name: SpaceToRight
column.summary: The amount of space to the right of each field. Overrides the form and global defaults. -1 indicates to use default. That way, 0 means 0 space. Not used for SigBox or MedicationList which use form level instead.

column.name: EFormImportRuleNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: FieldName
column.summary: If empty, this is a global rule. if the field name matches a DbLink value, then this applies to the Db field. Otherwise, it must be a Non-db field. It will first try to match a reportable name and then a label.

column.name: Situation
column.summary: Enum:EnumEFormImportSituation

Enumeration.name: EnumEFormImportSituation
Enumeration.EnumValue: 0-Original blank and entered new value
3-Setup UI explains the fields that this can apply to.

column.name: Action
column.summary: Enum:EnumEFormImportAction

Enumeration.name: EnumEFormImportAction
Enumeration.EnumValue: 3-Setup UI explains the fixes that can be made.

column.name: EServiceCode
column.summary: Enum:eServiceCode EService that this short GUID applies to.

Enumeration.name: eServiceCode
Enumeration.summary: Used by EServiceSignal.ServiceCode. Each service will have an entry here. Stored as an int for forward compatibility.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 49 - Used by ShortGuidLookup to redirect from an OD-generated Short URL to a long URL provided by customer.

column.name: PermType
column.summary: Enum:EnumPermType Some permissions will treat a zero FKey differently. Some denote it as having access to everything for that PermType. I.e. Reports.

Enumeration.name: EnumPermType
Enumeration.summary: A hard-coded list of permissions which may be granted to usergroups.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 257 - Allow users to copy perio charts in the Perio Chart window.

column.name: PermType
column.summary: Enum:EnumPermType Some permissions will treat a zero FKey differently. Some denote it as having access to everything for that PermType. I.e. Reports.

Enumeration.name: EnumPermType
Enumeration.summary: A hard-coded list of permissions which may be granted to usergroups.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 257 - Allow users to copy perio charts in the Perio Chart window.

column.name: PearlLayer
column.summary: Enum:Pearl.EnumCategoryOD This is how we hide and show layers for Pearl objects in the Imaging module.

Enumeration.name: Pearl.EnumCategoryOD
Enumeration.summary: This is for showing/hiding layers. Jordan-This list is tentative. I feel like there are a few missing. Each incoming Pearl annotation or toothpart must be able to be assigned to exactly one of these.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 5 - Caries -Progressed.
6 - Notable Margin.
12 - Bone (Tooth Part).
13 - Cementum (Tooth Part).
14 - Dentin (Tooth Part).
15 - Enamel (Tooth Part).
16 - Pulp (Tooth Part).
17 - Restoration (Tooth Part).
18 - Inferior Alveolar Nerve (Tooth Part). Not included in legend.
19 - Sinus (Tooth Part). Not included in legend.
20 - NasalCavity (Tooth Part). Not included in legend.
21 - Caries -Incipient.

column.name: NotificationType
column.summary: Enum:MobileNotificationType The type of notification. Example: TP. This will determine what actions the mobile app will perform upon retrieving this notification.

Enumeration.name: MobileNotificationType
Enumeration.summary: The different types of mobile notifications. Preserve order. CI = Checkin portion of app (eClipboard). ODM = ODMobile
Enumeration.EnumValue: Tells the device that is currently filling out forms to add an eForm to the list. For this type, the list of primary keys will have two items: the PatNum and the EFormNum in that order.
Tells the device that is currently filling out forms to remove an eForm from the list. For this type, the list of primary keys will have two items: the PatNum and the EFormNum in that order.

column.name: ApptNum
column.summary: FK to Appointment.AptNum

column.name: StatementNum
column.summary: FK to Statement.StatementNum

column.name: ChartNumber
column.summary: Usually blank. Alternative and supplement to PatNum. Can take alphanumeric. Usually set during conversion or when bridging to imaging software. Historically, it typically showed as a sticker on the outside of a paper chart. Max length 100 to support larger ids for bridging to imaging softwares.

column.name: PearlRequestNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: RequestId
column.summary: Request ID given to Pearl to uniquely identify this request. Generated as a GUID before uploading an image to Pearl.

column.name: DocNum
column.summary: FK to document. Links this request to the image that was sent. This is sufficient for mounts because mount images are sent individually to Pearl.

column.name: RequestStatus
column.summary: Enum:EnumPearlStatus Keeps track of the request's status. Can be Polling, Received, or Error.

Enumeration.name: EnumPearlStatus
Enumeration.EnumValue: 0 - An individual machine is actively polling Pearl.
1 - The image was successfully processed and AI annotations were returned from Pearl.
2 - An error occurred on Pearl’s side. Only set for errors that prevent this request from ever being fulfilled.
3 - Pearl did not give results within the timeout period of 10 minutes. Polling for this request can be retried.

column.name: DateTSent
column.summary: The time the image was originally sent to Pearl.

column.name: DateTChecked
column.summary: The most recent time an API call was made to Pearl to check the status of this request.

column.name: PermType
column.summary: Enum:EnumPermType

Enumeration.name: EnumPermType
Enumeration.summary: A hard-coded list of permissions which may be granted to usergroups.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 257 - Allow users to copy perio charts in the Perio Chart window.

column.name: PermType
column.summary: Enum:EnumPermType

Enumeration.name: EnumPermType
Enumeration.summary: A hard-coded list of permissions which may be granted to usergroups.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 257 - Allow users to copy perio charts in the Perio Chart window.

column.name: DefaultFormatRaw
column.summary: Determines whether the UserQuery window loads with the 'Raw' format radio button pre-selected. For a new userquery, this is set based on pref.UserQueryDefaultRaw.

column.name: PermType
column.summary: Enum:EnumPermType Some permissions will treat a zero FKey differently. Some denote it as having access to everything for that PermType. I.e. Reports.

Enumeration.name: EnumPermType
Enumeration.summary: A hard-coded list of permissions which may be granted to usergroups.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 8. Currently covers a wide variety of setup functions.
10 - DEPRECATED - Uses date restrictions. Covers editing/deleting of Completed, EO, and EC procs. Deleting procs of other statuses are covered by ProcDelete.
14. Uses date restrictions.
15. Uses date restrictions.
16. Uses date restrictions.
18. Uses date restrictions.
20. Not used anymore.
21 Not used anymore.
23. Includes setting procedures complete.
24. At least one user must have this permission.
27. AppointmentDelete permission required in order to delete appointments.
31. Uses date restrictions.
32. Uses date restrictions.
37. Uses date restrictions. Edit Batch Insurance Payment.
38. Uses date restrictions.
39. DEPRECATED
40. Uses date restrictions.
41. Uses date restrictions. All other equipment functions are covered by .Setup.
42. Uses date restrictions. Also used in audit trail to log web form importing.
43. Uses date restrictions.
44. Uses date restrictions.
45. Uses date restrictions.
46. Shows the fee textbox in the proc edit window.
49. Uses date restrictions. This only applies to non-completed procs. Deletion of completed procs is covered by ProcCompleteStatusEdit.
50 - Only used at OD HQ. No user interface.
51- Allows user to edit all providers. This is not fine-grained enough for extremely large organizations such as dental schools, so other permissions are being added as well.
64- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking.
65- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking. Only tracks changes to carriername, not any other carrier info.

66- (Was named TaskEdit prior to version 14.2.39) When editing an existing task: delete the task, edit original description, or double click on note rows. Even if you don't have the permission, you can still edit your own task description (but not the notes) as long as it's in your inbox and as long as nobody but you has added any notes.
67- Add or delete lists and list columns..
68- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking. Tracks copying of patient information. Required by EHR.
69- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking. Tracks printing of patient information. Required by EHR.
70- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking. Tracks viewing of patient medical information.
71- Tracks creation and editing of patient problems.
72- Tracks creation and edting of patient medications.
73- Tracks creation and editing of patient allergies.
74- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking. Tracks creation and editing of patient family health history.
75- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking. Patient Portal access of patient information. Required by EHR.
77- Assign this permission to a staff person who will administer setting up and editing Dental School Students in the system.
78- Assign this permission to an instructor who will be allowed to assign Grades to Dental School Students as well as manage classes assigned to them.
79- Uses date restrictions. Has a unique audit trail so that users can track specific ortho chart edits.
80- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking. Mainly used for ortho clinics.
81- Assign this permission to a staff person who will edit evaluations in case of an emergency. This is not meant to be a permanent permission given to a group.
82- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking.
83- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking.
84- Allows user to edit other users' tasks.
85- Allows user to send unsecured email
86- Allows user to send webmail
87- Allows user to run, edit, and write non-released queries.
88- Security permission for assignment of benefits.
89- Audit trail for images and documents in the image module. There is no user interface in the security window for this permission because it is only used for tracking.
90- Allows editing of all measure events. Also used to track changes made to events.
91- Allows users to edit settings in the eServices Setup window. Also causes the Listener Service monitor thread to start upon logging in.
92- Allows users to edit Fee Schedules throughout the program. Logs editing of fee schedule properties.
93- Allows user to edit and delete provider specific fees overrides.
94- Allows user to merge patients.
95- Only used in Claim History Status Edit
96- Allows user to edit a completed appointment. AppointmentCompleteDelete permission required in order to delete completed appointments.
97- Audit trail for deleting webmail messages. There is no user interface in the security window for this permission.
98- Audit trail for saving a patient with required fields missing. There is no user interface in the security window for this permission.
99- Allows user to merge referrals.

100- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking. Currently only used for tracking automatically changing the IsCpoe flag on procedures. Can be enhanced to do more in the future. There is only one place where we could have automatically changed IsCpoe without a corresponding log of a different permission. That place is in the OnClosing of the Procedure Edit window. We update this flag even when the user Cancels out of it.
101- Allows user to use the provider merge tool.
102- Allows user to use the medication merge tool.
103- Allow users to use the Quick Add tool in the Account module.
104- Allow users to send claims.
105- Allow users to create new task lists.
106 - Audit when a new patient is added.
107- Allows changing the settings for graphical repots.
108 - Audit when a patient is edited and restrict editing patients.
109 - Audit when an insurance plan is created. Currently only used in X12 834 insurance plan import.
110 - Audit when an insurance plan is edited. Currently only used in X12 834 insurance plan import.
111 - InsSub Created. Currently only used in X12 834 insurance plan import and in API.
112 - Audit when an insurance subscriber is edited. Currently only used in X12 834 insurance plan import.
113 - Audit when a patient is added to an insurance plan. Currently only used in X12 834 insurance plan import.
114 - Audit when a patient is dropped from an insurance plan. Currently only used in X12 834 insurance plan import.
115 - Allows users to be assigned Insurance Verifications.
116 - Allows users to bypass the global lock date to add paysplits.
117 - DEPRECATED - Uses date restrictions. Covers editing some fields of completed procs.
118 - Uses date restrictions based on the SecDateEntry field as the claim date. Covers deleting a claim of any status (Sent, Waiting to Send, Received, etc).

119 - Covers editing the Write-off and Write-off Override fields for claimprocs as well as deleting/creating claimprocs. Uses date/days restriction based on the attached proc.DateEntryC; unless it's a total payment, then uses claimproc.SecDateEntry.Applies to all plan types (i.e. PPO, Category%, Capitation, etc).
120 - Allows users to change appointment confirmation status.
121 - Audit trail for when users change graphical settings for another workstation in FormGraphics.cs.
122 - Audit Trail (Separated from SecurityAdmin permission)
123 - Allows the user to change the presenter on a treatment plan.
124 - Allows users to use the Alphabetize Provider button from FormProviderSetup to permanently re-order providers.
125 - Allows editing of claimprocs that are marked as received status.
126 - Used to diagnose an error in statement creation. Audit Trail Permission Only
127 - User has access to ODTouch.
128 - For logging purposes only. Used when PatPlans are created and not otherwise logged.
129 - Allows the user to change a patient's primary provider, with audit trail logging.
131 - Allows users to change a patient's billing type.
132 - Allows viewing annual prod inc of all providers instead of just a single provider.
133 - Allows running daily reports. DEPRECATED.
134 - Allows viewing daily prod inc of all providers instead of just a single provider
135 - Allows user to change the appointment schedule flag.
136 - Allows deleting sheets when they're associated to patients.
137 - Allows updating custom tracking on claims.
138 - Allows people to set graphics option for the workstation and other computers.
139 - Allows user to change the fields within the Ortho tab of the Ins Plan Edit window.
140 - Allows user to change the provider on claimproc when claimproc is attached to a claim.
141 - Audit when insurance plans are merged.
142 - Allows user to combine carriers.
143 - Allows user to edit popups. A user without this permission will still be able to edit their own popups.
144 - Allows user to select new insplan from list prior to dropping current insplan associated with a patplan.
145 - Allows user to edit their own signed ortho charts even if they don't have full permission.
146 - Allows user to edit procedure notes that they created themselves if they don't have full permission.
147 - Allows user to edit group notes signed by other users. If a user does not have this permission, they can still edit group notes that they themselves have signed.
148 - Allows user to lock and unlock wiki pages. Also allows the user to edit locked wiki pages.
149 - Allows user to create, edit, close, and delete payment plans.
150 - Used for logging when a claim is created, cancelled, or saved.
151- Allows user to run command queries. Command queries are any non-SELECT queries for any non-temporary table.
152 - Gives user access to the replication setup window.
153 - Allows user to edit and delete sent and received pre-auths. Uses date restriction.
154 - Edit fees (for logging only). Security log entry for this points to feeNum instead of CodeNum.
155 - Log ClaimProcEdit
156 - Logs changes to recalls, recalltypes, and recaltriggers.

157 - Allows users with this permission the ability to edit procedure codes. Users with the Setup permission have this by default. Logs changes made to individual proc codes (excluding fee changes) including when run from proc code tools.
158 - Allows users with this permission the ability to add new users. Security admins have this by default.
159 - Allows users with this permission the ability to view claims.
160 - Allows users to run the Repeat Charge Tool.
161 - Logs when a discount plan is added or dropped from a patient.
162 - Allows users with this permission the ability to sign treatment plans.
163 - Allows users with this permission to edit an existing EO or EC procedure.
164 - Allows users to search for patients in all clinics even when they are restricted to clinics. Also allows user to reassign patient clinic.

165 - Allows users to edit patient information for archived patients. This really only stops editing inside Patient Edit window. Also see ArchivedPatientSelect. Blocking user from patient selection prevents changes to all the other tables.
166 - HQ only. Allows users to use the persistent option in the Commlog drop down.
167 - Logs when a phone number has had its ownership verified. For OD HQ only.
168 - HQ only. Allows users to make changes to Sales Tax type adjustments.
169 - Allows user to set last verified dates for insurance benefits. Also allows access to FormInsVerificationList.
170 - Logs when a credit card is moved from one patient to another. Makes a log for both patients. Audit Trail Permission Only.
171 - Logs when aging is being ran and from where.
172 - HQ only. Allows user to add, edit, and delete Headmaster services and devices.
173 - Allows user to view a specific Dashboard Widget.
174 - Prevent users from creating bulk claims from the Procs Not Billed Report if past the lock date.
175 - Logging into patient portal. Used for audit trail only.
176 - Allows user to create and edit FAQ objects shown by the help button(?).
177 - HQ only. Alows user to edit feature request.
178- Logs when a reminder task is popped up. Used for audit trail only.
179 - Logs when changes are made to supplemental backup settings inside the FormBackup window.
180 - Logs when a user sends a Web Sched Recall through the Recall List. Used for audit trail only
181 - Allows the user to unmask patient SSN for temporary viewing. Logs any unmasks in the audit trail
182 - Allows the user to unmask patient DOB for temporary viewing. Logs any unmasks in the audit trail
183 - Logs when the family aging table has been truncated. For audit trails only.
184 - Logs when discount plans are merged. For audit trails only.
185 - Uses date restrictions. Allows user to change status of a completed procedure, or delete compeleted procedure
186 - Allows user to add an adjustment to a procedure (date locked)
187 - Misc Edit that includes "Do Not Bill Ins" and "Hide Graphics" (date locked)
188 - Edit the note of a completed procedure
189 - Edit main information of a procedure that is not already covered by the other permissions. Is not all inclusive.

190 - User can create, edit, and delete time card adjustments for protected leave on their time card of the current pay period. Users that also have the Edit All Time Cards permission, have this permission for all time cards.
191 - Logs when a time card adjustment is created, edited, or deleted.
192 - Permission for users to monitor queries
193 - Permission for users to create commlogs.
194 - Permission for users to modify and discard webforms
195 - Close other sessions of Open Dental Cloud
196 - Permission for Repeating Charge creation.
197 - Permission for Repeating Charge update.
198 - Permission for Repeating Charge deletion.
199 - User can open the zoom window and edit zoom level. Used to block remote application users who all share the same computer.
200 - Permission for forms added to eclipboard mobile check in.
201. Uses date restrictions.
202. Permission to Scan, Import, and Create Images.
203 - Permission to update Employee Certifications.
204 - Permission to set up Certifications.
205 - Permission to create Employers.
206 - Permission to allow users to login to ODCloud from any IP Address.
207 - Logging only. Creates an entry if a medicationpat.PatNote needs to be truncated before sending to DoseSpot.
208 - Allows user to edit a payment plan charge date that has an APR.
209 - Logs when discount plans are added. For audit trails only.
210 - Logs when discount plans are edited. For audit trails only.
211 - Permission to allow users without FeeSchedEdit permission to update fee schedule while receiving claims.
212 - Permission for managing high security program properties.
213 - Logs when a patient's credit card is edited.
214 - Allows user to edit medication definitions.
215 - Allows user to edit allergy definitions.
216 - Allows user to setup and use Advertising features like Postcards.
217 - Allows user to view text messages.
218 - Allows uer to send text messages.
219 - Allows user to merge prescriptions.
220 - Allows user to add or update Definitions.
221 - Allows user to install Open Dental updates.

222 - Denies users access to specific adjustment types. Special type of permission where having this permission actually denies users access. If a usergroup has an entry for this permission, then they do not have access to the adjustment type with the defnum that is stored in grouppermission.FKey. Pattern approved by Jordan.
223 - Allows user to export statements as CSV files.
224 - Allows users to edit carriers.
225 - Logs when API subscriptions are added or deleted. For audit trails only.
226 - Logs changes to global lock date. For audit trails only.
228 - Allows user to delete tasks.
229 - Allows user to use setup wizard.
230 - Allows user to use show features.
231 - Allows user to setup printer.
232 - Allows user to add provider.
233 - Allows user to edit clinic.
234 - Allows the editing of customer accounts for the ODApi via the BCM.
235 - Logs when registration keys are created. For audit trails only.
236 - Logs when registration keys are edited. For audit trails only.
237 - Allows user to delete appointments.
238 - Allows user to delete completed appointments.
239 - Logs when Appointment Types are edited. For audit trails only.
240 - Only used at OD HQ. Allows users to make high level changes in regards to texting.
241 - Logs when web chat sessions are edited. For audit trails only.
242 - Allows users to access FormSuppliers
243 - Logs when any supply purchases are created, placed, or deleted.
244 - Only used at OD HQ. Ability to edit table rows via Broadcast Monitor.
245 - Allows users to resize appointments.
246 - Logs when a user pays with a credit card. For Audit Trails only.
247 - Only for viewing the audit trail in FormEditAppointment
248 - Logs when a user edits a payment plan charge.
249 - Also see ArchivedPatientEdit. Blocking user from patient selection prevents changes to all the other tables besides the patient table. It's more rigorous.
250 - Only used at OD HQ. Ability to edit Cloud tab info via Broadcast Monitor.
251 - Only used at OD HQ. Ability to listen to live calls.
252 - Ability to edit Fee Billed to Insurance in FormClaimProc
253 - Allow users to merge allergies.
254 - Only used at OD HQ. Ability to open the AI chat window.
255 - Allow users to edit BadgeIds in the userod table.
256 - Internal Child Daycare only. Allow users to make changes to the daycare. Only userd at HQ.
257 - Allow users to copy perio charts in the Perio Chart window.

Even if you don't have the permission, you can still edit your own task description (but not the notes) as long as it's in your inbox and as long as nobody but you has added any notes.
67- Add or delete lists and list columns..
68- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking. Tracks copying of patient information. Required by EHR.
69- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking. Tracks printing of patient information. Required by EHR.
70- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking. Tracks viewing of patient medical information.
71- Tracks creation and editing of patient problems.
72- Tracks creation and edting of patient medications.
73- Tracks creation and editing of patient allergies.
74- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking. Tracks creation and editing of patient family health history.
75- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking. Patient Portal access of patient information. Required by EHR.
77- Assign this permission to a staff person who will administer setting up and editing Dental School Students in the system.
78- Assign this permission to an instructor who will be allowed to assign Grades to Dental School Students as well as manage classes assigned to them.
79- Uses date restrictions. Has a unique audit trail so that users can track specific ortho chart edits.
80- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking. Mainly used for ortho clinics.
81- Assign this permission to a staff person who will edit evaluations in case of an emergency. This is not meant to be a permanent permission given to a group.
82- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking.
83- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking.
84- Allows user to edit other users' tasks.
85- Allows user to send unsecured email
86- Allows user to send webmail
87- Allows user to run, edit, and write non-released queries.
88- Security permission for assignment of benefits.
89- Audit trail for images and documents in the image module. There is no user interface in the security window for this permission because it is only used for tracking.
90- Allows editing of all measure events. Also used to track changes made to events.
91- Allows users to edit settings in the eServices Setup window. Also causes the Listener Service monitor thread to start upon logging in.
92- Allows users to edit Fee Schedules throughout the program. Logs editing of fee schedule properties.
93- Allows user to edit and delete provider specific fees overrides.
94- Allows user to merge patients.
95- Only used in Claim History Status Edit
96- Allows user to edit a completed appointment. AppointmentCompleteDelete permission required in order to delete completed appointments.
97- Audit trail for deleting webmail messages. There is no user interface in the security window for this permission.
98- Audit trail for saving a patient with required fields missing. There is no user interface in the security window for this permission.
99- Allows user to merge referrals.

100- There is no user interface in the security window for this permission. It is only used for tracking. Currently only used for tracking automatically changing the IsCpoe flag on procedures. Can be enhanced to do more in the future. There is only one place where we could have automatically changed IsCpoe without a corresponding log of a different permission. That place is in the OnClosing of the Procedure Edit window. We update this flag even when the user Cancels out of it.
101- Allows user to use the provider merge tool.
102- Allows user to use the medication merge tool.
103- Allow users to use the Quick Add tool in the Account module.
104- Allow users to send claims.
105- Allow users to create new task lists.
106 - Audit when a new patient is added.
107- Allows changing the settings for graphical repots.
108 - Audit when a patient is edited and restrict editing patients.
109 - Audit when an insurance plan is created. Currently only used in X12 834 insurance plan import.
110 - Audit when an insurance plan is edited. Currently only used in X12 834 insurance plan import.
111 - InsSub Created. Currently only used in X12 834 insurance plan import and in API.
112 - Audit when an insurance subscriber is edited. Currently only used in X12 834 insurance plan import.
113 - Audit when a patient is added to an insurance plan. Currently only used in X12 834 insurance plan import.
114 - Audit when a patient is dropped from an insurance plan. Currently only used in X12 834 insurance plan import.
115 - Allows users to be assigned Insurance Verifications.
116 - Allows users to bypass the global lock date to add paysplits.
117 - DEPRECATED - Uses date restrictions. Covers editing some fields of completed procs.
118 - Uses date restrictions based on the SecDateEntry field as the claim date. Covers deleting a claim of any status (Sent, Waiting to Send, Received, etc).

119 - Covers editing the Write-off and Write-off Override fields for claimprocs as well as deleting/creating claimprocs. Uses date/days restriction based on the attached proc.DateEntryC; unless it's a total payment, then uses claimproc.SecDateEntry.Applies to all plan types (i.e. PPO, Category%, Capitation, etc).
120 - Allows users to change appointment confirmation status.
121 - Audit trail for when users change graphical settings for another workstation in FormGraphics.cs.
122 - Audit Trail (Separated from SecurityAdmin permission)
123 - Allows the user to change the presenter on a treatment plan.
124 - Allows users to use the Alphabetize Provider button from FormProviderSetup to permanently re-order providers.
125 - Allows editing of claimprocs that are marked as received status.
126 - Used to diagnose an error in statement creation. Audit Trail Permission Only
127 - User has access to ODTouch.
128 - For logging purposes only. Used when PatPlans are created and not otherwise logged.
129 - Allows the user to change a patient's primary provider, with audit trail logging.
131 - Allows users to change a patient's billing type.
132 - Allows viewing annual prod inc of all providers instead of just a single provider.
133 - Allows running daily reports. DEPRECATED.
134 - Allows viewing daily prod inc of all providers instead of just a single provider
135 - Allows user to change the appointment schedule flag.
136 - Allows deleting sheets when they're associated to patients.
137 - Allows updating custom tracking on claims.
138 - Allows people to set graphics option for the workstation and other computers.
139 - Allows user to change the fields within the Ortho tab of the Ins Plan Edit window.
140 - Allows user to change the provider on claimproc when claimproc is attached to a claim.
141 - Audit when insurance plans are merged.
142 - Allows user to combine carriers.
143 - Allows user to edit popups. A user without this permission will still be able to edit their own popups.
144 - Allows user to select new insplan from list prior to dropping current insplan associated with a patplan.
145 - Allows user to edit their own signed ortho charts even if they don't have full permission.
146 - Allows user to edit procedure notes that they created themselves if they don't have full permission.
147 - Allows user to edit group notes signed by other users. If a user does not have this permission, they can still edit group notes that they themselves have signed.
148 - Allows user to lock and unlock wiki pages. Also allows the user to edit locked wiki pages.
149 - Allows user to create, edit, close, and delete payment plans.
150 - Used for logging when a claim is created, cancelled, or saved.
151- Allows user to run command queries. Command queries are any non-SELECT queries for any non-temporary table.
152 - Gives user access to the replication setup window.
153 - Allows user to edit and delete sent and received pre-auths. Uses date restriction.
154 - Edit fees (for logging only). Security log entry for this points to feeNum instead of CodeNum.
155 - Log ClaimProcEdit
156 - Logs changes to recalls, recalltypes, and recaltriggers.

157 - Allows users with this permission the ability to edit procedure codes. Users with the Setup permission have this by default. Logs changes made to individual proc codes (excluding fee changes) including when run from proc code tools.
158 - Allows users with this permission the ability to add new users. Security admins have this by default.
159 - Allows users with this permission the ability to view claims.
160 - Allows users to run the Repeat Charge Tool.
161 - Logs when a discount plan is added or dropped from a patient.
162 - Allows users with this permission the ability to sign treatment plans.
163 - Allows users with this permission to edit an existing EO or EC procedure.
164 - Allows users to search for patients in all clinics even when they are restricted to clinics. Also allows user to reassign patient clinic.

165 - Allows users to edit patient information for archived patients. This really only stops editing inside Patient Edit window. Also see ArchivedPatientSelect. Blocking user from patient selection prevents changes to all the other tables.
166 - HQ only. Allows users to use the persistent option in the Commlog drop down.
167 - Logs when a phone number has had its ownership verified. For OD HQ only.
168 - HQ only. Allows users to make changes to Sales Tax type adjustments.
169 - Allows user to set last verified dates for insurance benefits. Also allows access to FormInsVerificationList.
170 - Logs when a credit card is moved from one patient to another. Makes a log for both patients. Audit Trail Permission Only.
171 - Logs when aging is being ran and from where.
172 - HQ only. Allows user to add, edit, and delete Headmaster services and devices.
173 - Allows user to view a specific Dashboard Widget.
174 - Prevent users from creating bulk claims from the Procs Not Billed Report if past the lock date.
175 - Logging into patient portal. Used for audit trail only.
176 - Allows user to create and edit FAQ objects shown by the help button(?).
177 - HQ only. Alows user to edit feature request.
178- Logs when a reminder task is popped up. Used for audit trail only.
179 - Logs when changes are made to supplemental backup settings inside the FormBackup window.
180 - Logs when a user sends a Web Sched Recall through the Recall List. Used for audit trail only
181 - Allows the user to unmask patient SSN for temporary viewing. Logs any unmasks in the audit trail
182 - Allows the user to unmask patient DOB for temporary viewing. Logs any unmasks in the audit trail
183 - Logs when the family aging table has been truncated. For audit trails only.
184 - Logs when discount plans are merged. For audit trails only.
185 - Uses date restrictions. Allows user to change status of a completed procedure, or delete compeleted procedure
186 - Allows user to add an adjustment to a procedure (date locked)
187 - Misc Edit that includes "Do Not Bill Ins" and "Hide Graphics" (date locked)
188 - Edit the note of a completed procedure
189 - Edit main information of a procedure that is not already covered by the other permissions. Is not all inclusive.

190 - User can create, edit, and delete time card adjustments for protected leave on their time card of the current pay period. Users that also have the Edit All Time Cards permission, have this permission for all time cards.
191 - Logs when a time card adjustment is created, edited, or deleted.
192 - Permission for users to monitor queries
193 - Permission for users to create commlogs.
194 - Permission for users to modify and discard webforms
195 - Close other sessions of Open Dental Cloud
196 - Permission for Repeating Charge creation.
197 - Permission for Repeating Charge update.
198 - Permission for Repeating Charge deletion.
199 - User can open the zoom window and edit zoom level. Used to block remote application users who all share the same computer.
200 - Permission for forms added to eclipboard mobile check in.
201. Uses date restrictions.
202. Permission to Scan, Import, and Create Images.
203 - Permission to update Employee Certifications.
204 - Permission to set up Certifications.
205 - Permission to create Employers.
206 - Permission to allow users to login to ODCloud from any IP Address.
207 - Logging only. Creates an entry if a medicationpat.PatNote needs to be truncated before sending to DoseSpot.
208 - Allows user to edit a payment plan charge date that has an APR.
209 - Logs when discount plans are added. For audit trails only.
210 - Logs when discount plans are edited. For audit trails only.
211 - Permission to allow users without FeeSchedEdit permission to update fee schedule while receiving claims.
212 - Permission for managing high security program properties.
213 - Logs when a patient's credit card is edited.
214 - Allows user to edit medication definitions.
215 - Allows user to edit allergy definitions.
216 - Allows user to setup and use Advertising features like Postcards.
217 - Allows user to view text messages.
218 - Allows uer to send text messages.
219 - Allows user to merge prescriptions.
220 - Allows user to add or update Definitions.
221 - Allows user to install Open Dental updates.

222 - Denies users access to specific adjustment types. Special type of permission where having this permission actually denies users access. If a usergroup has an entry for this permission, then they do not have access to the adjustment type with the defnum that is stored in grouppermission.FKey. Pattern approved by Jordan.
223 - Allows user to export statements as CSV files.
224 - Allows users to edit carriers.
225 - Logs when API subscriptions are added or deleted. For audit trails only.
226 - Logs changes to global lock date. For audit trails only.
228 - Allows user to delete tasks.
229 - Allows user to use setup wizard.
230 - Allows user to use show features.
231 - Allows user to setup printer.
232 - Allows user to add provider.
233 - Allows user to edit clinic.
234 - Allows the editing of customer accounts for the ODApi via the BCM.
235 - Logs when registration keys are created. For audit trails only.
236 - Logs when registration keys are edited. For audit trails only.
237 - Allows user to delete appointments.
238 - Allows user to delete completed appointments.
239 - Logs when Appointment Types are edited. For audit trails only.
240 - Only used at OD HQ. Allows users to make high level changes in regards to texting.
241 - Logs when web chat sessions are edited. For audit trails only.
242 - Allows users to access FormSuppliers
243 - Logs when any supply purchases are created, placed, or deleted.
244 - Only used at OD HQ. Ability to edit table rows via Broadcast Monitor.
245 - Allows users to resize appointments.
246 - Logs when a user pays with a credit card. For Audit Trails only.
247 - Only for viewing the audit trail in FormEditAppointment
248 - Logs when a user edits a payment plan charge.
249 - Also see ArchivedPatientEdit. Blocking user from patient selection prevents changes to all the other tables besides the patient table. It's more rigorous.
250 - Only used at OD HQ. Ability to edit Cloud tab info via Broadcast Monitor.
251 - Only used at OD HQ. Ability to listen to live calls.
252 - Ability to edit Fee Billed to Insurance in FormClaimProc
253 - Allow users to merge allergies.
254 - Only used at OD HQ. Ability to open the AI chat window.
255 - Allow users to edit BadgeIds in the userod table.
256 - Internal Child Daycare only. Allow users to make changes to the daycare. Only userd at HQ.
257 - Allow users to copy perio charts in the Perio Chart window.
